Introducing the METAAB R package

The METAAB R package was developed in R language and is distributed under the GPL 3.0 license. It provides user-friendly and reliable functions for analyzing multi-environment trial data using Additive Main Effects and Multiplicative Interaction (AMMI) and Best Linear Unbiased Prediction (BLUP) models.

Installation

The latest development version can be installed from github:

# download the package from Github
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("TiagoOlivoto/METAAB")

Main features

The METAAB package provides useful functions for analyzing data from multi-environment trials. The main features include, but are not limited to:

  • Cross-validation procedures for AMMI and BLUP
  • AMMI-based stability indexes
  • BLUP-based stability indexes
  • Graphics solutions for generating biplots
  • Multi-trait indexes for simultaneous selection
